acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since the LD50 is >= 8.0 g/kg for rabbits (HSDB, 2003), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: The rat LCLo (1 hour) is 50 g/m3 (RTECS, accessed in October 2007), and the 4-hour conversion value of the rat LCLo = (50 g/m3) /4 = 12.5 g/m3 = 12.5 mg/L. Since the LC50 is estimated to be > 12.5 mg/L, the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category using classification criteria for dust.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Since the LD50 is 15.2 g/kg for female and male rats (HSDB, 2003), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It is rated as Cat. 2 by the EU (2007), but no details such as rationale for the classification are provided. Thus, classification is not possible.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The following reports are available: application of the substance onto the skin of mice was associated with DNA adduct formation; reverse mutation test using Salmonella typhimurium gave positive results; and UDS test using rat hepatocytes yielded positive results (RTECS, accessed in October 2007). However, since no other in vivo test results are obtainable, classification is not possible due to insufficient test result available.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_solids.rationale: It is an organic compound containing oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine), which is chemically bonded to sulfur. Since no test results based on standardized testing methods are available, classification is not possible.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Oral administration of the substance in mice on Gestational Days 8-12 was associated with inhibition of testicular and ovarian function in the offspring. In addition, female offspring from the substance-exposed dams produced less litters than that from untreated dams (HSDB (2003)). Based on these reports, the substance was classified into Category 2.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: It may cause severe allergic reaction (anaphylactic shock) (HSDB, 2003). However, due to insufficient data available, classification is not possible.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: It contains chemical groups (S=O) associated with self-reactive properties. Due to lack of test results, classification is not possible.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the report that a 100 mg application of the substance to rabbits induced moderate irritation (RTECS, accessed in October 2007), the substance was classified into Category 2A.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It is reported to be a possible irritant (HSFS, 1999), but details of the study including evidence that supports the conclusion are not provided. Thus, classification is not possible due to insufficient test results available.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: It may cause severe allergic reaction (anaphylactic shock) (HSDB, 2003). However, due to insufficient data available, classification is not possible.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In a test in which rats underwent 1-hour inhalation exposure to a dust form of this substance, gross necropsy revealed hemorrhaging of the lungs in decedents, and pulmonary and adrenal congestion in survivors (HSDB, 2003). However, exposure concentrations associated with these symptoms are above the range of Category 2 guidance values. As such, classification is not possible.
